groups.name: cache
groups.description: General configuration properties for a GemFireCache.

groups.name: cluster
groups.description: Configuration properties for the entire cluster.

groups.name: peer-security
groups.description: Configuration properties for peer (cluster member) security.

groups.name: service
groups.description: Configuration properties for GemFire/Geode embedded services.

groups.name: session
groups.description: Configuration properties for Spring Session backed by Apache Geode or Pivotal GemFire.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.name
properties.description: Name of the Apache Geode / Pivotal GemFire member.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.locators
properties.description: Comma-delimited list of Locator endpoints formatted as: locator1[port1],...,locatorN[portN]

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.use-bean-factory-locator
properties.description: Enable the SDG BeanFactoryLocator when mixing Spring config with GemFire/Geode native config (e.g. cache.xml) and you wish to configure GemFire objects declared in cache.xml with Spring.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.copy-on-read
properties.description: Configure whether a copy of an object returned from Region.get(key) is made.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.critical-heap-percentage
properties.description: Percentage of heap at or above which the cache is considered in danger of becoming inoperable.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.critical-off-heap-percentage
properties.description: Percentage of off-heap at or above which the cache is considered in danger of becoming inoperable.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.enable-auto-region-lookup
properties.description: Configure whether to lookup Regions configured in GemFire/Geode native config and declare them as Spring beans.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.eviction-heap-percentage
properties.description: Percentage of heap at or above which the eviction should begin on Regions configured for HeapLRU eviction.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.eviction-off-heap-percentage
properties.description: Percentage of off-heap at or above which the eviction should begin on Regions configured for HeapLRU eviction.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.log-level
properties.description: Configure the log-level of an Apache Geode / Pivotal GemFire cache.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.name
properties.description: Alias for 'spring.data.gemfire.name'.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.client.durable-client-id
properties.description: Used only for clients in a client/server installation. If set, this indicates that the client is durable and identifies the client. The ID is used by servers to reestablish any messaging that was interrupted by client downtime.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.client.durable-client-timeout
properties.description: Used only for clients in a client/server installation. Number of seconds this client can remain disconnected from its server and have the server continue to accumulate durable events for it.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.client.keep-alive
properties.description: Configure whether the server should keep the durable client's queues alive for the timeout period.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.compression.bean-name
properties.description: Name of a Spring bean implementing org.apache.geode.compression.Compressor.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.compression.region-names
properties.description: Comma-delimited list of Region names for which compression will be configured.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.off-heap.memory-size
properties.description: Determines the size of off-heap memory used by GemFire/Geode in megabytes (m) or gigabytes (g); for example 120g.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.off-heap.region-names
properties.description: Comma-delimited list of Region names for which off-heap will be configured.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.peer.enable-auto-reconnect
properties.description: Configure whether member (Locators & Servers) will attempt to reconnect and reinitialize the cache after it has been forced out of the cluster by a network partition event or has otherwise been shunned by other members.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.peer.lock-lease
properties.description: Configures the length, in seconds, of distributed lock leases obtained by this cache.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.peer.lock-timeout
properties.description: Configures the number of seconds a cache operation will wait to obtain a distributed lock lease.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.peer.message-sync-interval
properties.description: Configures the frequency (in seconds) at which a message will be sent by the primary cache-server to all the secondary cache-server nodes to remove the events which have already been dispatched from the queue.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.peer.search-timeout
properties.description: Configures the number of seconds a cache get operation can spend searching for a value.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.peer.use-cluster-configuration
properties.description: Configures whether this GemFire cache member node would pull it's configuration meta-data from the cluster-based Cluster Configuration Service.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.auto-startup
properties.description: Configures whether the CacheServer should be started automatically at runtime.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.bind-address
properties.description: Configures the IP address or hostname that this cache server will listen on.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.hostname-for-clients
properties.description: Configures the IP address or hostname that server locators will tell clients that this cache server is listening on.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.load-poll-interval
properties.description: Configures the frequency in milliseconds to poll the load probe on this cache server.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.max-connections
properties.description: Configures the maximum client connections allowed.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.max-message-count
properties.description: Configures the maximum number of messages that can be enqueued in a client queue.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.max-threads
properties.description: Configures the maximum number of threads allowed in this cache server to service client requests.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.max-time-between-pings
properties.description: Configures the maximum amount of time between client pings.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.message-time-to-live
properties.description: Configures the time (in seconds) after which a message in the client queue will expire.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.port
properties.description: Configures the port on which this cache server listens for clients.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.socket-buffer-size
properties.description: Configures buffer size of the socket connection to this CacheServer.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.subscription-capacity
properties.description: Configures the capacity of the client queue.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.subscription-disk-store-name
properties.description: Configures the name of the DiskStore for client subscription queue overflow.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.subscription-eviction-policy
properties.description: Configures the eviction policy that is executed when capacity of the client subscription queue is reached.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cache.server.tcp-no-delay
properties.description: Configures the outgoing Socket connection tcp-no-delay setting.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.cluster.region.type
properties.description: Configuration setting used to specify the data management policy used when creating Regions on the servers in the cluster.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.allow-force-compaction
properties.description: Configures whether to allow DiskStore.forceCompaction() to be called on Regions using a DiskStore.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.auto-compact
properties.description: Configures whether to cause the disk files to be automatically compacted.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.compaction-threshold
properties.description: Configures the threshold at which an oplog will become compactable.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.directory.location
properties.description: Configures the system directory where the GemFire/Geode DiskStore (oplog) files will be stored.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.directory.size
properties.description: Configures the amount of disk space allowed to store DiskStore (oplog) files.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.disk-usage-critical-percentage
properties.description: Configures the critical threshold for disk usage as a percentage of the total disk volume.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.disk-usage-warning-percentage
properties.description: Configures the warning threshold for disk usage as a percentage of the total disk volume.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.max-oplog-size
properties.description: Configures the maximum size in megabytes a single oplog (operation log) is allowed to be.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.queue-size
properties.description: Configures the maximum number of operations that can be asynchronously queued.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.time-interval
properties.description: Configures the number of milliseconds that can elapse before data written asynchronously is flushed to disk.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.disk.store.write-buffer-size
properties.description: Configures the write buffer size in bytes.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.entities.base-packages
properties.description: Comma-delimited list of package names indicating the start points for the entity scan.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.locator.host
properties.description: Configures the IP address or hostname of the system NIC to which the embedded Locator will be bound to listen for connections.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.locator.port
properties.description: Configures the network port to which the embedded Locator will listen for connections.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.logging.level
properties.description: Configures the log-level of an Apache Geode / Pivotal GemFire cache; Alias for 'spring.data.gemfire.cache.log-level'.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.logging.log-disk-space-limit
properties.description: Configures the amount of disk space allowed to store log files.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.logging.log-file
properties.description: Configures the pathname of the log file used to log messages.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.logging.log-file-size
properties.description: Configures the maximum size of a log file before the log file is rolled.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.management.use-http
properties.description: Configures whether to use the HTTP protocol to communicate with a GemFire/Geode Manager.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.management.http.host
properties.description: Configures the IP address or hostname of the GemFire/Geode Manager running the HTTP service.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.management.http.port
properties.description: Configures the port used by the GemFire/Geode Manager's HTTP service to listen for connections.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.manager.access-file
properties.description: Configures the Access Control List (ACL) file used by the Manager to restrict access to the JMX MBeans by the clients.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.manager.bind-address
properties.description: Configures the IP address or hostname of the system NIC used by the Manager to bind and listen for JMX client connections.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.manager.hostname-for-clients
properties.description: Configures the hostname given to JMX clients to ask the Locator for the location of the Manager.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.manager.password-file
properties.description: By default, the JMX Manager will allow clients without credentials to connect. If this property is set to the name of a file then only clients that connect with credentials that match an entry in this file will be allowed.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.manager.port
properties.description: Configures the port used by th Manager to listen for JMX client connections.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.manager.start
properties.description: Configures whether to start the Manager service at runtime.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.manager.update-rate
properties.description: Configures the rate, in milliseconds, at which this member will push updates to any JMX Managers.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pdx.disk-store-name
properties.description: Configures the name of the DiskStore used to store PDX type meta-data to disk when PDX is persistent.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pdx.ignore-unread-fields
properties.description: Configures whether PDX ignores fields that were unread during deserialization.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pdx.persistent
properties.description: Configures whether PDX persists type meta-data to disk.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pdx.read-serialized
properties.description: Configures whether a Region entry is returned as a PdxInstance or deserialized back into object form on read.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pdx.serialize-bean-name
properties.description: Configures the name of a custom Spring bean implementing org.apache.geode.pdx.PdxSerializer.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.free-connection-timeout
properties.description: Configures the timeout used to acquire a free connection from a Pool.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.idle-timeout
properties.description: Configures the amount of time a connection can be idle before expiring (and closing) the connection.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.load-conditioning-interval
properties.description: Configures the interval for how frequently the pool will check to see if a connection to a given server should be moved to a different server to improve the load balance.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.locators
properties.description: Comma-delimited list of Locator endpoints in the format: locator1[port1],...,locatorN[portN]

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.max-connections
properties.description: Configures the maximum number of client to server connections that a Pool will create.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.min-connections
properties.description: Configures the minimum number of client to server connections that a Pool will maintain.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.multi-user-authentication
properties.description: Configures whether the created Pool can be used by multiple authenticated users.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.ping-interval
properties.description: Configures how often to ping servers to verify that they are still alive.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.pr-single-hop-enabled
properties.description: Configures whether to perform single-hop data access operations between the client and servers. When true the client is aware of the location of partitions on servers hosting Regions with DataPolicy.PARTITION.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.read-timeout
properties.description: Configures the number of milliseconds to wait for a response from a server before timing out the operation and trying another server (if any are available).

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.ready-for-events
properties.description: Configures whether to signal the server that the client is prepared and ready to receive events.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.retry-attempts
properties.description: Configures the number of times to retry a request after timeout/exception.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.server-group
properties.description: Configures the group that all servers a Pool connects to must belong to.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.servers
properties.description: Comma-delimited list of CacheServer endpoints in the format: server1[port1],...,serverN[portN]

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.socket-buffer-size
properties.description: Configures the socket buffer size for each connection made in all Pools.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.statistic-interval
properties.description: Configures how often to send client statistics to the server.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.subscription-ack-interval
properties.description: Configures the interval in milliseconds to wait before sending acknowledgements to the CacheServer for events received from the server subscriptions.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.subscription-enabled
properties.description: Configures whether the created Pool will have server-to-client subscriptions enabled.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.subscription-message-tracking-timeout
properties.description: Configures the messageTrackingTimeout attribute which is the time-to-live period, in milliseconds, for subscription events the client has received from the server.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.subscription-redundancy
properties.description: Configures the redundancy level for all Pools server-to-client subscriptions.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.pool.thread-local-connections
properties.description: Configures the thread local connections policy for all Pools.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.username
properties.description: Configures the name of the user used to authenticate with the servers.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.password
properties.description: Configures the user password used to authenticate with the servers.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.properties-file
properties.description: Configures the system pathname to a properties file containing security credentials.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.client.accessor
properties.description: Static creation method returning an AccessControl object, which determines authorization of client-server cache operations.

deprecation.reason: Used by GemFire/Geode's old Auth framework, which has now been replaced by the GemFire/Geode SecurityManager interface.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.client.accessor-post-processor
properties.description: The callback that should be invoked in the post-operation phase, which is when the operation has completed on the server but before the result is sent to the client.

deprecation.reason: Used by GemFire/Geode's old Auth framework, which has now been replaced by the GemFire/Geode SecurityManager interface.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.client.authentication-initializer
properties.description: Static creation method returning an AuthInitialize object, which obtains credentials for peers in a cluster.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.client.authenticator
properties.description: Static creation method returning an Authenticator object used by a cluster member (Locator, Server) to verify the credentials of a connecting client.

deprecation.reason: Used by GemFire/Geode's old Auth framework, which has now been replaced by the GemFire/Geode SecurityManager interface.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.client.diffie-hellman-algorithm
properties.description: Used for authentication. For secure transmission of sensitive credentials like passwords, you can encrypt the credentials using the Diffie-Hellman key-exchange algorithm. Do this by setting the security-client-dhalgo system property on the clients to the name of a valid, symmetric key cipher supported by the JDK.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.log.file
properties.description: Configures the pathname to a log file used for security log messages.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.log.level
properties.description: Configures the log-level for security log messages.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.manager.class-name
properties.description: Configures name of a class implementing org.apache.geode.security.SecurityManager.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.peer.authentication-initializer
properties.description: Static creation method returning an AuthInitialize object, which obtains credentials for peers in a cluster.

deprecation.reason: Used by GemFire/Geode's old Auth framework, which has now been replaced by the GemFire/Geode SecurityManager interface.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.peer.authenticator
properties.description: Static creation method returning an Authenticator object, which is used by a peer to verify the credentials of a connecting node.

deprecation.reason: Used by GemFire/Geode's old Auth framework, which has now been replaced by the GemFire/Geode SecurityManager interface.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.peer.verify-member-timeout
properties.description: Configures the timeout in milliseconds used by a peer to verify membership of an unknown authenticated peer requesting a secure connection.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.post-processor.class-name
properties.description: Configures the name of a class implementing the org.apache.geode.security.PostProcessor interface that can be used to change the returned results of Region get operations.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.shiro.ini-resource-path
properties.description: Configures the Apache Geode System Property referring to the location of an Apache Shiro INI file that configures the Apache Shiro Security Framework in order to secure Apache Geode.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.certificate.alias.cluster
properties.description: Configures the alias to the stored SSL certificate used by the cluster to secure communications.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.certificate.alias.default-alias
properties.description: Configures the default alias to the stored SSL certificate used to secure communications across the entire GemFire/Geode system.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.certificate.alias.gateway
properties.description: Configures the alias to the stored SSL certificate used by the WAN Gateway Senders/Receivers to secure communications.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.certificate.alias.jmx
properties.description: Configures the alias to the stored SSL certificate used by the Manager's JMX based JVM MBeanServer and JMX clients to secure communications.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.certificate.alias.locator
properties.description: Configures the alias to the stored SSL certificate used by the Locator to secure communications.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.certificate.alias.server
properties.description: Configures the alias to the stored SSL certificate used by clients and servers to secure communications.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.certificate.alias.web
properties.description: Configures the alias to the stored SSL certificate used by the embedded HTTP server to secure communications (HTTPS).

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.ciphers
properties.description: Comma-separated list of SSL ciphers or “any”.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.components
properties.description: Comma-delimited list of GemFire/Geode components (e.g. WAN) to be configured for SSL communication.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.keystore
properties.description: Configures the system pathname to the Java KeyStore file storing certificates for SSL.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.keystore-config.password
properties.description: Configures the password used to access the Java KeyStore file.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.keystore-config.type
properties.description: Configures the password used to access the Java KeyStore file (e.g. JKS).

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.protocols
properties.description: Comma-separated list of SSL protocols or “any”.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.require-authentication
properties.description: Configures whether 2-way authentication is required.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.truststore
properties.description: Configures the system pathname to the trust store (Java KeyStore file) storing certificates for SSL.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.truststore-config.password
properties.description: Configures the password used to access the trust store (Java KeyStore file).

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.truststore-config.type
properties.description: Configures the password used to access the trust store (Java KeyStore file; e.g. JKS).

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.security.ssl.web-require-authentication
properties.description: Configures whether 2-way HTTP authentication is required.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.service.http.bind-address
properties.description: Configures the IP address or hostname of the system NIC used by the embedded HTTP server to bind and listen for HTTP(S) connections.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.service.http.port
properties.description: Configures the port used by the embedded HTTP server to listen for HTTP(S) connections.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.service.http.ssl-require-authentication
properties.description: Configures whether 2-way HTTP authentication is required.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.service.http.dev-rest-api-start
properties.description: Configures whether to start the Developer REST API web service. A full installation of Apache Geode or Pivotal GemFire is required and you must set the $GEODE environment variable.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.service.memcached.port
properties.description: Configures the port of the embedded Memcached server (service).

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.service.memcached.protocol
properties.description: Configures the protocol used by the embedded Memcached server (service).

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.service.redis.bind-address
properties.description: Configures the IP address or hostname of the system NIC used by the embedded Redis server to bind an listen for connections.

properties.name: spring.data.gemfire.service.redis.port
properties.description: Configures the port used by the embedded Redis server to listen for connections.

properties.name: spring.session.data.gemfire.cache.client.pool.name
properties.description: Name of the Pool used to send data access operations between the client and server(s).

properties.name: spring.session.data.gemfire.cache.client.region.shortcut
properties.description: Configures the DataPolicy used by the client Region to manage (HTTP) Session state.

properties.name: spring.session.data.gemfire.cache.server.region.shortcut
properties.description: Configures the DataPolicy used by the server Region to manage (HTTP) Session state.

properties.name: spring.session.data.gemfire.session.attributes.indexable
properties.description: Configures names of Session attributes for which an Index will be created.

properties.name: spring.session.data.gemfire.session.expiration.max-inactive-interval-seconds
properties.description: Configures the number of seconds in which a Session can remain inactive before it expires.

properties.name: spring.session.data.gemfire.session.region.name
properties.description: Configures name of the (client/server) Region used to manage (HTTP) Session state.

properties.name: spring.session.data.gemfire.session.serializer.bean-name
properties.description: Configures the name of a Spring bean implementing org.springframework.session.data.gemfire.serialization.SessionSerializer

values.description: This level indicates a serious failure. In general, severe messages describe events that are of considerable importance that will prevent normal program execution. You will likely need to shut down or restart at least part of your system to correct the situation.
This level indicates that something is wrong in your system. You should be able to continue running, but the operation noted in the error message failed.

This level indicates a potential problem. In general, warning messages describe events that are of interest to end users or system managers, or that indicate potential problems in the program or system.
This is for informational messages, typically geared to end users and system administrators.
This level provides static configuration messages that are often used to debug problems associated with particular configurations.
This level provides tracing information that is generally of interest to developers. It is used for the lowest volume, most important, tracing messages.

This level indicates a serious failure. In general, severe messages describe events that are of considerable importance that will prevent normal program execution. You will likely need to shut down or restart at least part of your system to correct the situation.
This level indicates that something is wrong in your system. You should be able to continue running, but the operation noted in the error message failed.

This level indicates a potential problem. In general, warning messages describe events that are of interest to end users or system managers, or that indicate potential problems in the program or system.
This is for informational messages, typically geared to end users and system administrators.
This level provides static configuration messages that are often used to debug problems associated with particular configurations.
This level provides tracing information that is generally of interest to developers. It is used for the lowest volume, most important, tracing messages.
Entries from the client subscription queue are not evicted to disk.
Entries from the client subscription queue are evicted to disk when capacity (memory size) is reached.
Entries from the client subscription queue are evicted to disk when capacity (entry count) is reached.
Local-only Region; operations are not sent to other members.
Local-only Region with heap LRU eviction; operations are not sent to other members.
Local-only Region with entries overflowing to disk; operations are not sent to other members.
Local-only, persistent Region with entries saved to disk; operations are not sent to other members.
Local-only, persistent Region with entries overflowing and saved to disk; operations are not sent to other members.
Partitioned Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster).
Partitioned Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with heap LRU eviction.
Partitioned Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with entries overflowing to disk.
Partitioned persistent Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with entries saved to disk.
Partitioned, persistent Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with entries overflowing and saved to disk.
Partition Proxy Region having no local state (data accessor); all operations are forwarded to peers hosting data for the Region.
Partition Proxy Region having no local state (data accessor) with a redundancy of 1; all operations are forwarded to peers hosting data for the Region.
Partition Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1.
Partition Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1 and heap LRU eviction.
Partition Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1 and entries overflowing to disk.
Partition, persistent Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1 and entries saved to disk.
Partition, persistent Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1 and entries overflowing and saved to disk.
Replicated Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster).
Replicated Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster) with heap LRU eviction.
Replicated Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster) with entries overflowing to disk.
Replicated, persistent Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster) with entries saved to disk.
Replicated, persistent Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster) with entries overflowing and saved to disk.
Replicated Proxy Region with no local state; all operations (except queries) are forwarded to peers hosting data for the Region.
Refers to all GemFire/Geode system components.
Refers to the entire GemFire/Geode cluster.
Refers to WAN Gateway Senders and Receivers.
Refers to JMX enabled software (e.g. Gfsh, JConsole, JVisualVM) and servers (e.g. JVM MBeanServer).
Refers to a GemFire/Geode Locator.
Refers to a GemFire/Geode CacheServer.
Refers to GemFire/Geode's embedded HTTP server (Jetty).
A client Region with local state but can also send operations to a server.
A client Region with local state and heap LRU eviction, but can also send operations to a server.
A client Region with local state and entry overflow, but can also send operations to a server.
A local-only client Region; no operations are forwarded to a server.
A local-only client Region with heap LRU eviction; no operations are forwarded to a server.
A local-only client Region with entry overflow; no operations are forwarded to a server.
A local-only, persistent client Region with entries saved to disk; no operations are forwarded to a server.
A local-only, persistent client Region with entries overflowed and saved to disk; no operations are forwarded to a server.
A client Region with no state; all operations are forwarded to a server.
Local-only Region; operations are not sent to other members.
Local-only Region with heap LRU eviction; operations are not sent to other members.
Local-only Region with entries overflowing to disk; operations are not sent to other members.
Local-only, persistent Region with entries saved to disk; operations are not sent to other members.
Local-only, persistent Region with entries overflowing and saved to disk; operations are not sent to other members.
Partitioned Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster).
Partitioned Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with heap LRU eviction.
Partitioned Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with entries overflowing to disk.
Partitioned persistent Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with entries saved to disk.
Partitioned, persistent Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with entries overflowing and saved to disk.
Partition Proxy Region having no local state (data accessor); all operations are forwarded to peers hosting data for the Region.
Partition Proxy Region having no local state (data accessor) with a redundancy of 1; all operations are forwarded to peers hosting data for the Region.
Partition Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1.
Partition Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1 and heap LRU eviction.
Partition Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1 and entries overflowing to disk.
Partition, persistent Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1 and entries saved to disk.
Partition, persistent Region (data is sharded across members in the cluster) with a redundancy of 1 and entries overflowing and saved to disk.
Replicated Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster).
Replicated Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster) with heap LRU eviction.
Replicated Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster) with entries overflowing to disk.
Replicated, persistent Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster) with entries saved to disk.
Replicated, persistent Region (all data is sharded by members in the cluster) with entries overflowing and saved to disk.
Replicated Proxy Region with no local state; all operations (except queries) are forwarded to peers hosting data for the Region.
